abstract: National Transportation Safety Board report concludes that two airliners landed in error at Reagan National Airport in March after lone tower controller fell asleep and regional officials reacted incorrectly.
snippet: Two airliners landed in error in March after the lone tower controller on a midnight shift fell asleep and regional officials reacted incorrectly, a federal investigation concluded.
lead_paragraph: Two airliners landed in error in March after the lone tower controller on a midnight shift fell asleep and regional officials reacted incorrectly, a federal investigation concluded.

headline.main: Report Faults Sleeping and Awake Controllers
headline.print_headline: Report Faults Sleeping and Awake Controllers
headline.seo: Report Faults Sleeping and Awake Controllers
